mn128:15.3.pli: “Idha mayaṁ, bhante, appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharantā obhāsañceva sañjānāma dassanañca rūpānaṁ.
mn128:15.3.en: “Well, sir, while meditating diligent, keen, and resolute, we perceive both light and vision of forms.

mn128:16.2.pli: Ahampi sudaṁ, anuruddhā, pubbeva sambodhā anabhisambuddho bodhisattova samāno obhāsañceva sañjānāmi dassanañca rūpānaṁ.
mn128:16.2.en: Before my awakening—when I was still unawakened but intent on awakening—I too perceived both light and vision of forms.

mn128:17.1.pli: So kho ahaṁ, anuruddhā, appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi dassanañca rūpānaṁ.
mn128:17.1.en: While meditating diligent, keen, and resolute, I perceived both light and vision of forms.

mn128:26.1.pli: So kho ahaṁ, anuruddhā, appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi dassanañca rūpānaṁ.
mn128:26.1.en: While meditating diligent, keen, and resolute, I perceived both light and vision of forms.

mn128:28.1.pli: So kho ahaṁ, anuruddhā, appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañhi kho sañjānāmi, na ca rūpāni passāmi;
mn128:28.1.en: While meditating diligent, keen, and resolute, I perceived light but did not see forms,

mn128:28.9.pli: ‘yasmiñhi kho ahaṁ samaye rūpanimittaṁ amanasikaritvā obhāsanimittaṁ manasi karomi, obhāsañhi kho tasmiṁ samaye sañjānāmi, na ca rūpāni passāmi.
mn128:28.9.en: ‘When I don’t focus on the foundation of the forms, but focus on the foundation of the light, then I perceive light and do not see forms.

mn128:28.10.pli: Yasmiṁ panāhaṁ samaye obhāsanimittaṁ amanasikaritvā rūpanimittaṁ manasi karomi, rūpāni hi kho tasmiṁ samaye passāmi na ca obhāsaṁ sañjānāmi—
mn128:28.10.en: But when I don’t focus on the foundation of the light, but focus on the foundation of the forms, then I see forms and do not perceive light.

mn128:29.1.pli: So kho ahaṁ, anuruddhā, appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto parittañceva obhāsaṁ sañjānāmi, parittāni ca rūpāni passāmi;
mn128:29.1.en: While meditating diligent, keen, and resolute, I perceived limited light and saw limited forms,

mn128:29.2.pli: appamāṇañceva obhāsaṁ sañjānāmi, appamāṇāni ca rūpāni passāmi:
mn128:29.2.en: or I perceived limitless light and saw limitless forms.

mn128:29.10.pli: Sohaṁ parittena cakkhunā parittañceva obhāsaṁ sañjānāmi, parittāni ca rūpāni passāmi.
mn128:29.10.en: and with limited vision I perceive limited light and see limited forms.

mn128:29.12.pli: Sohaṁ appamāṇena cakkhunā appamāṇañceva obhāsaṁ sañjānāmi, appamāṇāni ca rūpāni passāmi—
mn128:29.12.en: and with limitless vision I perceive limitless light and see limitless forms.

an8.64:1.3.pli: “pubbāhaṁ, bhikkhave, sambodhā anabhisambuddho bodhisattova samāno obhāsaññeva kho sañjānāmi, no ca rūpāni passāmi.
an8.64:1.3.en: “Mendicants, before my awakening—when I was still not awake but intent on awakening—I perceived light but did not see visions.

an8.64:2.2.pli: ‘sace kho ahaṁ obhāsañceva sañjāneyyaṁ rūpāni ca passeyyaṁ;
an8.64:2.2.en: ‘What if I were to both perceive light and see visions?

an8.64:3.1.pli: So kho ahaṁ, bhikkhave, aparena samayena appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi, rūpāni ca passāmi;
an8.64:3.1.en: So after some time, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, I perceived light and saw visions.

an8.64:4.2.pli: ‘sace kho ahaṁ obhāsañceva sañjāneyyaṁ, rūpāni ca passeyyaṁ, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṁ santiṭṭheyyaṁ sallapeyyaṁ sākacchaṁ samāpajjeyyaṁ;
an8.64:4.2.en: ‘What if I were to perceive light and see visions; and associate with those deities, converse, and engage in discussion?

an8.64:5.1.pli: So kho ahaṁ, bhikkhave, aparena samayena appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi, rūpāni ca passāmi, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṁ santiṭṭhāmi sallapāmi sākacchaṁ samāpajjāmi;
an8.64:5.1.en: So after some time … I perceived light and saw visions. And I associated with those deities, conversed, and engaged in discussion.

an8.64:6.2.pli: ‘sace kho ahaṁ obhāsañceva sañjāneyyaṁ, rūpāni ca passeyyaṁ, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṁ santiṭṭheyyaṁ sallapeyyaṁ sākacchaṁ samāpajjeyyaṁ, tā ca devatā jāneyyaṁ:
an8.64:6.2.en: ‘What if I were to perceive light and see visions; and associate with those deities, converse, and engage in discussion;

an8.64:7.1.pli: So kho ahaṁ, bhikkhave, aparena samayena appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto obhāsañceva sañjānāmi, rūpāni ca passāmi, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṁ santiṭṭhāmi sallapāmi sākacchaṁ samāpajjāmi, tā ca devatā jānāmi:
an8.64:7.1.en: So after some time … I perceived light and saw visions. And I associated with those deities … And I found out which orders of gods those deities came from.

an8.64:8.2.pli: ‘sace kho ahaṁ obhāsañceva sañjāneyyaṁ, rūpāni ca passeyyaṁ, tāhi ca devatāhi saddhiṁ santiṭṭheyyaṁ sallapeyyaṁ sākacchaṁ samāpajjeyyaṁ, tā ca devatā jāneyyaṁ:
an8.64:8.2.en: ‘What if I were to perceive light and see visions; and associate with those deities, converse, and engage in discussion;

64. At Gāyā Head
